urls.title: River Thames Conditions
urls.description: Welcome to the Environment Agency's online River Thames conditions update service which displays our current advice to river users. We display warning boards at our locks to inform river users of conditions that may make navigating difficult and dangerous. This page shows our current advice for each reach of the river between Cricklade and Teddington. We will update this information regularly when warning boards are being displayed at locks and as river conditions change. Upstream of St John's Lock No

tweets.text: I agree, the @EnvAgency monitors only pick up the levels at that exact location.The gas seems to form a cloud which blasts certain areas,it can sit there or carry on to somewhere else.The monitors just don‚Äôt pick that up or interior of houses #stopthestink We are being poisoned https://t.co/mO2eclzxnp

Environmental breach after breach and people are suffering. I'm currently visiting my Dad's house in Silverdale, I've only been here a few days and my nose, throat and eyes are already irritated and the smell is vile @EnvAgency #StopTheStink https://t.co/M5DOye80Iq

Wild fish and their waters need your help. We have launched a Parliamentary Petition to give @EnvAgency the funds and freedom they need to protect English rivers. Please sign and share our petition to give rivers a fighting chance. #standingupforrivers
https://t.co/oxNkHEqHQL https://t.co/0sZJF68qs8
And the @EnvAgency do what exactly? https://t.co/FJmcCwQcYd
‚ÄòIt‚Äôs terrifying‚Äô: the English village overwhelmed by landfill stink https://t.co/F9K2jCUwGQ

@SuzVW @davemh72 @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency I got that they are never going to close it down, & are unable to bring walleys into compliance so court case for residents is the only option, as @NewsNBC gone quiet now council elections are over

@NickMincher @EnvAgencyMids Agreed. I have no idea why a methane flux box survey is going to take another 4 months. Also, if they were serious about getting a solution as quickly as possible, then all waste acceptance should be halted to avoid it being a distraction to the remedial work.

@EnvAgencyMids @DrMickSalt So when they‚Äôve done that - we‚Äôll have reports showing inadequacy and plans for them to ignore/not follow. It‚Äôll be months until any real actions to make a difference. Whilst we have to put up with the worsening situation. Timelines aren‚Äôt urgent enough!
@ollyandpatch @EnvAgencyMids Compensation needed üí∏üí∏üí∞üí∞

It is not getting any better. The gas stink from the landfill is increasing in intensity. A dreadful weekend and again tonight. No one should have to live like this. We are all looking for answers from @EnvAgencyMids and light at the end of this tunnel. @StinkStopthe https://t.co/JPdHJZJBqQ

@DrMickSalt @EnvAgencyMids ‚ÄòShutting it down won‚Äôt stop the odours‚Äô is their usual line. Whilst true, shutting down operations would stop it getting worse. Give them space to focus on remediation and resolution as a priority. We aren‚Äôt calling for just shutting it down - it needs shutting down and capping

@DrMariaNeira I wrote to the WHO some time ago questioning the guidelines used by the EA, they really need to be more clear making a safe level for inside properties near landfills,  I believe in America its 0.005 ppm for hydrogen sulphide, we are being poisoned in our homes because of this!
